interactions.question: What is this document about?
interactions.answer:
This document is about:
*   Disclaimer Statement
*   Profit Charging Information
*   Card Replacement and Cancellation
*   Reward Points
*   Foreign Airline Tickets
*   To report your lost or stolen Faysal Islami Noor card(s)
*   Excess Payments in the Faysal Islami Noor Account
*   Foreign Airline Tickets
*   Profit Calculation
*   Federal Excise Duty
*   Unsatisfactory Resolution
*   Message Of The Month
*   Contact Us
*   Cash Withdrawal
*   Disputed Transactions

retrieved_chunks.content:
## Disclaimer Statement

This communication/Message (including any attachments) may contain information that is privileged and/or confidential under applicable laws. If you are not the intended recipient or such recipient's employee or agent, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, copy or disclosure of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have recieved this communication in error, please immediately notify via return internet email to the sender and delete this communication without making any copy. Any unauthorized use or communication of this  communication/message in whole or in part is strictly prohibited. Please note that emails are susceptible to change. Faysal Bank Limited, shall not be liable for the improper or incomplete transmission of the information contained in this communication nor for any delay in its receipt or damage to your system. Faysal Bank Limited does not guarantee that the integrity of this communication has been maintained nor that this communication is free of viruses, interceptions or interference.

## Profit Charging Information:

No Profit will be demanded on a new retail transaction/ purchases if the total Required Payment is made in full within Payment Required Date for each billing cycle and no balance is carried forward from the previous months.

## Card Replacement and Cancellation

For  replacement  of  a  damaged  card,  a  written  request  by  the  basic Cardholder is mandatory in addition to the return of the old plastic, cut into  two  halves.  Ensure  that  the  chip  is  damaged.  In  case  of  Card cancellation, you are requested to send the card, cut into two halves with the chip damaged along with a written cancellation request or telephonic cancellation request

## Reward Points

The reward program is an incentive & promotional offer available only to the basic Noor card member and will be awarded SmilePoints & Eternal Points (as opted) on retail spend as defined by FBL. All points will be expired if not redeemed within 12 months. For EternalPoints, all points earned  will  be  charity/donated  on  quarterly  basis  to  any  charitable organization at bank's own discretion. The Bank reserves the right to change,  at  any  time,  the  amount  required  to  earn  points  and  the procedure of redemption.

## Foreign Airline Tickets

This may cause the receipt amount to differ from the amount billed to you. Use of your Faysal Islami Noor card outside Pakistan For all transactions outside Pakistan, the conversion from foreign currency amount to US Dollar  amount  is  billed  by  MasterCard  International  at  the  prevalent MasterCard International  exchange  rate. The  conversion  from  the  US Dollar  amount  to  the  Pakistani  Rupee  amount  is  processed  by  the Pakistan  Card  Centre. The  rate  charged  for  this  conversion  is  the prevailing open market rate quoted to us at that particular time. We also charge a handling fee, as per the Islamic Schedule of Charges. However,  please  also  note  that  all  foreign  exchange  conversions  are made as per the agreed Cardmember's Terms and Conditions governing your Faysal Islami Noor card.

## To report your lost or stolen Faysal Islami Noor card(s)

In case of loss or theft of your Faysal Islami Noor card(s) in and outside of  Pakistan,  please  notify  our  Contact  Centre  immediately.  This  will minimize your liability and protect you against any misuse of the stolen / lost card

## Excess Payments in the Faysal Islami Noor Account

Kindly  do  not  deposit  excess  cash  in  your  FBL  Islami  Noor  account exceeding your total dues as it comes under SBP regulatory violation. In case there is any excess cash in your FBL Islami Noor account, the Bank may refund the excess amount through Pay Order after deducting the Pay Order charges (as per Schedule of Charges).

## Foreign Airline Tickets

If  you  use  your  Faysal  Islami  Noor  card  to  pay  for  any  foreign  airline tickets, the amount that you signed for on the receipts/sales slips may be different  from  the  amount  that  you  are  subsequently  billed  in  your Statement  of  Account. This  is  because  any  purchase  of  tickets  of  a foreign (Non-Pakistani) airline is treated as a foreign currency transaction. Therefore, in accordance with the Cardmember Terms and Conditions, the transaction will be subject to all our applicable rules and procedures  for  foreign  currency  conversion  into  Pakistani  Rupees, based on the exchange rate being used by us at the time of conversion.

## Profit Calculation

Profit  rate,  as  per  the  Schedule  of  Charges  will  be  charged  on  your outstanding balance.For example, if you conduct a retail/cash transaction of PKR 15,000 on the 10th of January and your statement is generated on the 20th of January and you make a minimum payment of PKR  750  on  the  7th  of  February,  then  you  will  be  charged  with  an accrued Profit in the next statement generated on 20th of February of PKR 688.33 and your total outstanding will be PKR 14,938.3.

The agreed profit rate at the time of Musawamah (Tawarruq) will remain same till the maturity. However, the Profit rate may change at time of new tawarruq  transaction  or  limit  enhancement  and  communicated  to  the customer but the method of calculation will remain same.

Note:  For  more  details  and  information  refer  to  your  FBL  Islami  Noor Card welcome guide and Terms & Conditions. FBL reserve the rights to change any of the above mentioned charges.

## Federal Excise Duty

All government excise and stamp duties etc. levied as per Federal Excise Duty  Act  2005  and  correspondent  bank  charges  (if  any)  are  for  the customer's account and are non-reversible.

## Unsatisfactory Resolution

For  unsatisfactory  resolution,  you  may  write  to  Banking  Mohtasib Pakistan,  Shaheen  Complex,  M.R.  Kiyani  Road,  Karachi.  Telephone: +9221-99217334-38 or visit www.bankingmohtasib.gov.pk

## Message Of The Month

Your remaining balance of all installment plans (PIP) = Rs.

## Contact Us

If you need any help or information, or in case of any complaint, please contact our Contact Centre at 021 111 11 71 71 or write to us at the following addresses: Email: customercare@faysalbank.com

## Cash Withdrawal

Cardmember may use the Card to obtain Cash Withdrawal up to the limit decided by the Bank from time to time.

## Disputed Transactions

If you notice any discrepancy in the monthly statement or E Statement, the Cardmember should send us a written request within 14 days of the current statement date, otherwise the transaction would be deemed to be authentic and the Cardmember would be bound to make the payment for the entire amount.

## Federal Excise Duty

All government excise and stamp duties etc. levied as per Federal Excise Duty  Act  2005  and  correspondent  bank  charges  (if  any)  are  for  the customer's account and are non-reversible.

## Disclaimer Statement

This communication/Message (including any attachments) may contain information that is privileged and/or confidential under applicable laws. If you are not the intended recipient or such recipient's employee or agent, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, copy or disclosure of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have recieved this communication in error, please immediately notify via return internet email to the sender and delete this communication without making any copy. Any unauthorized use or communication of this  communication/message in whole or in part is strictly prohibited. Please note that emails are susceptible to change. Faysal Bank Limited, shall not be liable for the improper or incomplete transmission of the information contained in this communication nor for any delay in its receipt or damage to your system. Faysal Bank Limited does not guarantee that the integrity of this communication has been maintained nor that this communication is free of viruses, interceptions or interference.

## Card Replacement and Cancellation

For  replacement  of  a  damaged  card,  a  written  request  by  the  basic Cardholder is mandatory in addition to the return of the old plastic, cut into  two  halves.  Ensure  that  the  chip  is  damaged.  In  case  of  Card cancellation, you are requested to send the card, cut into two halves with the chip damaged along with a written cancellation request or telephonic cancellation request

## Cash Withdrawal

Cardmember may use the Card to obtain Cash Withdrawal up to the limit decided by the Bank from time to time.

## Disputed Transactions

If you notice any discrepancy in the monthly statement or E Statement, the Cardmember should send us a written request within 14 days of the current statement date, otherwise the transaction would be deemed to be authentic and the Cardmember would be bound to make the payment for the entire amount.

## Profit Charging Information:

No Profit will be demanded on a new retail transaction/ purchases if the total Required Payment is made in full within Payment Required Date for each billing cycle and no balance is carried forward from the previous months.

## Contact Us

If you need any help or information, or in case of any complaint, please contact our Contact Centre at 021 111 11 71 71 or write to us at the following addresses: Email: customercare@faysalbank.com

## Message Of The Month

Your remaining balance of all installment plans (PIP) = Rs.

## eCIB Reporting

The  Electronic  Credit  Information  Bureau  (eCIB)  of  State  Bank  of

Pakistan requires all banks and financial institutions to report all facilities, loans  and  advances,  irrespective  of  the  facilities/loan  amount,  to  the State Bank. Any defaults or delays in making regular payments against facilities/loans can affect credit worthiness of the customer and you may be unable to avail further financing from the banking system. Further, in case of consumer loans/financing, a default history will be maintained for a certain period after adjustment  of  default amount.  For  further information on eCIB, you may visit the following website: www.sbp.org.pk/ecibhelpdesk.

## Transactions at Fuel Stations

The maximum amount of transactions at fuel stations in one day cannot exceed PKR 100,000.

## Payment Options

You may pay any amount between the Minimum Payment Required and the Total Payment Required on your Faysal Islami Noor card statement, however  you  must  pay  at  least  the  minimum  payment  amount  on  or before  the  payment  required  (due)  date  (3  or  7  working  days  as applicable)  to  avoid  Musawmah  payment,  as  per  the  Schedule  of Charges. If you have booked an Installment Plan, then your remaining installment amount will not be included in the "Total Payment Required" amount and will appear separately on your statement.

## Reward Points

The reward program is an incentive & promotional offer available only to the basic Noor card member and will be awarded SmilePoints & Eternal Points (as opted) on retail spend as defined by FBL. All points will be expired if not redeemed within 12 months. For EternalPoints, all points earned  will  be  charity/donated  on  quarterly  basis  to  any  charitable organization at bank's own discretion. The Bank reserves the right to change,  at  any  time,  the  amount  required  to  earn  points  and  the procedure of redemption.

## Message Of The Month

Dear Customer, Faysal Bank has revised its Schedule of Charges effective from 1st Jul, 2025.

## Other Charges

Please refer to Faysal Islami Noor card Terms and Conditions and the Islamic Schedule of Charges for details of other charges applicable (also available on Bank Website) to your Faysal Islami Noor account.

## Musawamah (Delayed) Payment

In the event of delay in payment, beyond due date or payment made less than  Minimum  Payment  Required,  FBL  at  its  sole  discretion  may demand  the  Musawmah  payment  amount,  through  Monthly  Card Statement, as per Bank's applicable Schedule of Charges.

interactions.question: Summarize the key points
interactions.answer:
Here's a summary of the key points, extracted from the document:

*   Disputed Transactions: Written request must be sent within 14 days of the current statement date.
*   Reward Points: All points will be expired if not redeemed within 12 months.
*   Transactions at Fuel Stations: The maximum amount of transactions at fuel stations in one day cannot exceed PKR 100,000.
*   Payment Options: You must pay at least the minimum payment amount on or before the payment required (due) date (3 or 7 working days as applicable).
*   Message Of The Month: Faysal Bank has revised its Schedule of Charges effective from 1st Jul, 2025.

## Drop Box Banking

Enjoy the convenience of our Drop Box facility, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, located at selected Faysal Bank branches and our ATM off-sites in your respective city. For a complete list, please call our Contact Centre at 021 111 11 71 71.

## eCIB Reporting

The  Electronic  Credit  Information  Bureau  (eCIB)  of  State  Bank  of

Pakistan requires all banks and financial institutions to report all facilities, loans  and  advances,  irrespective  of  the  facilities/loan  amount,  to  the State Bank. Any defaults or delays in making regular payments against facilities/loans can affect credit worthiness of the customer and you may be unable to avail further financing from the banking system. Further, in case of consumer loans/financing, a default history will be maintained for a certain period after adjustment  of  default amount.  For  further information on eCIB, you may visit the following website: www.sbp.org.pk/ecibhelpdesk.

## Other Charges

Please refer to Faysal Islami Noor card Terms and Conditions and the Islamic Schedule of Charges for details of other charges applicable (also available on Bank Website) to your Faysal Islami Noor account.

## Reward Points

The reward program is an incentive & promotional offer available only to the basic Noor card member and will be awarded SmilePoints & Eternal Points (as opted) on retail spend as defined by FBL. All points will be expired if not redeemed within 12 months. For EternalPoints, all points earned  will  be  charity/donated  on  quarterly  basis  to  any  charitable organization at bank's own discretion. The Bank reserves the right to change,  at  any  time,  the  amount  required  to  earn  points  and  the procedure of redemption.

## Transactions at Fuel Stations

The maximum amount of transactions at fuel stations in one day cannot exceed PKR 100,000.
